page.title: 02THE BEACH
page.content: THE BEACH HAS A VERY SHALLOW GRADIENT, THEREFORE AT LOW TIDE IT IS VERY WIDE. THIS GIVES A LARGE AREA PROVIDING GOOD FOOD SOURCES FOR A WIDE VARIETY OF WILDLIFE , ESPECIALLY GULLS ( HERRING, BLACK HEADED AND LESSER BLACK HEADED). OYSTERCATCHERS AND OTHER WADERS CAN ALSO BE SEEN ON THE EXPOSED BEACH. THE VIEWS OVER THIS CORNER OF THE IRISH SEA TO THE MOUNTAINS OF NORTH WALES INCLUDE THE CONSTANT TOO AND FRO FROM LIVERPOOL OF SHIPS OF ALL KINDS. ACCESS TO THE BEACH IS AVAILABLE FROM THE NATIONAL TRUST CAR PARK, OR FROM AINSDALE TO THE NORTH AND FORMBY TO THE SOUTH.
